senses.ex: He paid attention to every detail of the painting.

Tips.title: Visual Imagery
Tips.description: Use 'detail' to highlight specific visual aspects that contribute to the overall image.
Tips.example: The artist's use of detail brought the landscape to life.

Tips.title: Not Insignificant
Tips.description: 'Detail' implies importance despite being a small part.
Tips.example: Don't overlook the details; they make the design special.

senses.ex: She explained the plan in detail.

Tips.title: Clarity in Communication
Tips.description: Providing details ensures clear and thorough understanding.
Tips.example: Please provide your instructions in detail.

Tips.title: Avoid Overwhelm
Tips.description: Too many details can be overwhelming; be concise when necessary.
Tips.example: She gave the directions in detail, but it was too much to remember.

senses.de: Describe or list something carefully and completely
senses.ex: The report details the findings of the investigation.

Tips.title: Exhaustiveness
Tips.description: To 'detail' in verb form means being exhaustive in listing elements or aspects.
Tips.example: The manual details each step of the assembly process.

Tips.title: Focus on Precision
Tips.description: 'Detailing' involves accuracy and precision in description or listing.
Tips.example: He detailed the events leading up to the incident with great accuracy.

senses.de: To choose someone to do a specific task
senses.ex: The teacher detailed a student to help clean up after class.

Tips.title: Purposeful Selection
Tips.description: When you 'detail' someone, it's intentional and for a specific reason.
Tips.example: She was detailed to organize the conference due to her exceptional skills.

Tips.title: Delegation
Tips.description: 'Detailing' someone often implies delegation of responsibility.
Tips.example: The sergeant detailed a soldier to lead the patrol.

senses.de: An individual feature, fact, or item
senses.ex: We need to consider every detail before making a decision.

Tips.title: Individual Importance
Tips.description: Each 'detail' contributes to forming a complete picture or understanding.
Tips.example: Examining the details can reveal the artwork's authenticity.

Tips.title: Critical Analysis
Tips.description: Analyzing details helps to grasp complex concepts or situations.
Tips.example: The detective focused on the details of the witnesses' statements.

Attribute.wordDefinition:
Attribute refers to a characteristic or quality that someone or something possesses. For example, a person may be described as having the attribute of kindness or intelligence.

Attribute is more commonly used to describe personality traits or inherent qualities, while detail is more commonly used to describe specific aspects or elements of something.

Characteristic.wordDefinition:
A characteristic is a distinguishing feature or quality of something or someone that helps identify or define it. For example, a cat's characteristic may be that it has fur, whiskers, and sharp claws.

A characteristic is a broader, more general feature that helps define something, while a detail is a more specific element that adds richness or complexity to that defining feature.

Component.wordDefinition:
A component is a part that contributes to a larger whole, like a piece of a puzzle. For example, a car has many components such as wheels, engine, and seats.

A detail refers to the specific features or characteristics that make up a component or an object.

A detail provides more information about a component.

For example, if we take the car's wheel as a component, its details would include the size, color, and shape.

Overall, components are the bigger parts that make up something, while details are the smaller features that provide a more comprehensive understanding of the components.

Element.wordDefinition:
Both detail and element refer to individual components or parts of a larger whole, but they can be used in slightly different ways.

Element can also refer to a specific part of something, but it tends to be used more broadly.

Element can refer to any basic or fundamental building block that makes up a larger structure or system.

If you're talking about a chemical compound, you might refer to the individual atoms that make up each element. Or, if you're designing a website, you might talk about the different design elements you want to incorporate, such as color schemes, images, and typography.

Detail tends to be used when you're talking about something that is more specific or focused, while element tends to be used in a broader sense, referring to any basic or fundamental part of something.

Factor.wordDefinition:
Factor refers to a contributing element or component that affects or influences an outcome. For example, in a math equation, a factor is a number that multiplies with other numbers to produce a result.

In a scientific experiment, a factor might be the temperature or the amount of a specific chemical used.

The key difference between the two words is that detail is more specific and focuses on individual aspects while factor is more general and focuses on the overall impact on a situation.

Feature.wordDefinition:
Detail refers to a small aspect or part of something, while feature refers to a prominent or important aspect or characteristic of something.

For example, the details of a painting might include the brushstrokes, colors, and shading, while the features of a car might include its horsepower, safety ratings, and entertainment system.

Details are important to consider when examining something closely or analyzing it in depth, while features are important to consider when comparing or evaluating different options.

Particular.wordDefinition:
Detail refers to specific information or facts about something, while particular refers to a specific thing or aspect of something.

For example, if you are describing a painting, the details would be the specific colors used or the brushstrokes used, while a particular aspect would be the subject matter of the painting.

In simpler terms, detail means specific information, and particular means a specific thing. These words are used in different contexts depending on what you are describing or discussing.

Specific.wordDefinition:
Specific refers to giving clear and precise information about a particular aspect of a subject. It focuses on one particular detail or characteristic of the subject.

For instance, a specific description of a book may include the name of the author, the number of pages, or the publication date.

Both words are applicable in different situations. Detail is generally used when you want to provide a comprehensive overview of something, while specific is used when you want to focus on one particular aspect of it.

quotes.Text: I like movies where you feel like you're going into another world, and no matter how many times you watch it, you're gonna see something new in that world. That level of detail really inspires me.
quotes.Title: Actor
quotes.Name: Nicolas Cage

quotes.Text: I was worried that one day, 40 years from now, I would look back and wouldn't be able to remember the details of my life, so I've written them all down.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Alicia Keys

quotes.Text: In the day-to-day life of a traveling musician, it's easy to miss so many details. The world goes by at high-speed; it will take your breath away.
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: Eric Burdon

quotes.Text: I think we all want to know where we came from and how we fit into the world, but some of us need to know how it all works in great detail.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: George Smoot

quotes.Text: I never regret anything. Because every little detail of your life is what made you into who you are in the end.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Drew Barrymore

quotes.Text: I think it's important that you know every detail when you open a store, that you pay attention to everything.
quotes.Title: French Businessman
quotes.Name: Francois Nars

quotes.Text: Men who wish to know about the world must learn about it in its particular details.
quotes.Title: Greek Philosopher
quotes.Name: Heraclitus

quotes.Text: There's nothing more interesting than the details of someone's life.
quotes.Title: British Novelist
quotes.Name: Robert Harris

quotes.Text: The success of a production depends on the attention paid to detail.
quotes.Title: American Producer
quotes.Name: David O. Selznick

quotes.Text: Once you get the right image the details aren't that important.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Abbie Hoffman
